alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:03PM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts up to 5 inches around Dulce. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow may reduce visibility below one-half mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains
